summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Department of Justice discussing whether to promote a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein and Prince Andrew on official DOJ social media channels. The discussion centers on whether the article is backed by an official press release or statement on the USAO's website.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the New York Times article being discussed for promotion; central figure in the criminal case.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in the New York Times article link about his connection to Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: The New York Times article being discussed is about their connection, as indicated by the URL.

events.title: NYT Article on Epstein and Prince Andrew
events.description: The New York Times publishes an article about Jeffrey Epstein and Prince Andrew, which is being considered for promotion by the DOJ's public affairs office.

keyFacts: Internal DOJ emails discuss promoting a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein and Prince Andrew on official social media.
The DOJ's public affairs office has a standing rule requiring official press releases or statements on justice.gov to back any tweeted articles.
The email chain shows coordination between DOJ public affairs personnel regarding media strategy for the Epstein case.
The document references a 'VW Epstein case page' on the USAO's website, indicating a dedicated public information resource for the case.
